before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"c94fi","text":"Add 4 volumes of ethanol (≥ 95%) to one volume of DNA Wash Buffer. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26jec","text":"          –  For 50-prep kit, add 20 ml of ethanol to 5 ml of Monarch DNA Wash Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bucrp","text":"          –  For 250-prep kit, add 100 ml of ethanol to 25 ml of Monarch DNA Wash Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duhg7","text":"All centrifugation steps should be carried out at   (~ ).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cusbs","text":"Please note: column holds 800 μl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"16.000","duration":0,"guid":"0C66CB80A0F011EAB5DEA52FDC0C1129","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"13.000","duration":0,"guid":"0F2C5420A0F011EAB5DEA52FDC0C1129","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3sl46","text":"This is the quick version of the Monarch® DNA Gel Extraction Kit Protocol (NEB #T1020). For the full protocol, please click here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":124,"length":4}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"FFF90610FD7846AF9AE3DEEF5D9CD4AF","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/11/23/monarch-dna-gel-extraction-kit-protocol-t1020"}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"bnjk1","text":"For detailed protocol and more information, visit www.neb.com/T1020","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":50,"length":17}],"data":[]},{"key":"217i1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6a2pu","text":"The full protocol is available here. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":31,"length":4}],"data":[]},{"key":"1u6ar","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"54a1n","text":"A video protocol is available here.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":30,"length":4}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4B1C08854ACE4EFF8491A1B7B2C4EB76","url":"https://www.neb.com/products/t1020-monarch-dna-gel-extraction-kit"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"DFF663D9AA144A6BAAEC992E8C5A7432","url":"https://www.neb.com/protocols/2015/11/23/monarch-dna-gel-extraction-kit-protocol-t1020"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"A6D42AD09B6E4A54BF900B97C87E32C8","url":"https://www.neb.com/tools-and-resources/video-library?videoid=%7B9113b074-49b0-4fdf-910e-6426f17c049a%7D"}}}}
keywords: Extracting, Monarch DNA Gel Extracting Kit, extracting dna,DNA,gel extraction

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5459f","text":"Excise the DNA fragment from the agarose gel, taking care to trim excess agarose. Transfer to a 1.5 ml microfuge tube and weigh the gel slice. Minimize exposure to UV light.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":143}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b9s0d","text":"Add 4 volumes of Gel Dissolving Buffer to the gel slice (e.g., 400 μl buffer per 100 μl or 100 mg agarose).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fvlu7","text":"Incubate the sample between 37–55°C (typically  ), vortexing periodically until the gel slice is completely dissolved (generally 5-10 minutes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":118}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a4u9v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"37ria","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ur62","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2ifcu","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"56B994A092FF11EA91D439D250BBAC0D","id":0,"label":"","temperature":"50","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ce3lh","text":"The time that takes a gel slice to melt depends on the size of the slice, the temperature used in the incubation as well as the percent agarose used in the gel. The time recommended above should be used just as a guideline.  ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"2":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ce3lh","text":"For DNA fragments \u003e 8 kb, an additional 1.5 volumes of water should be added after the slice is dissolved to mitigate the tighter binding of larger pieces of DNA (e.g., 100 μl gel slice: 400 μl Gel Dissolving Buffer: 150 μl water).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9t2mp","text":"Insert column into collection tube and load sample onto the column. Spin for  , then discard flow-through.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":106}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":77,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"16000","duration":60,"guid":"64269F7092FF11EA91D439D250BBAC0D","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7n7t7","text":"Re-insert column into collection tube. Add   and spin for  . Discarding flow-through is optional.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":61}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"74D4F29092FF11EA91D439D250BBAC0D","id":0,"label":" DNA Wash Buffer (with ethanol added)","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"16000","duration":60,"guid":"7F4ED51092FF11EA91D439D250BBAC0D","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fddsq","text":"Repeat Step 5: Re-insert column into collection tube. Add   and spin for  . Discarding flow-through is optional.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":76}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":58,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":73,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","guid":"837B8E9F92FF11EA95850A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":" DNA Wash Buffer (with ethanol added)","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"200","centrifuge":"16000","duration":60,"guid":"837B8F7C92FF11EA95850A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dhc6a","text":"Transfer column to a clean 1.5 ml microfuge tube. Use care to ensure that the tip of the column does not come into contact with the flow-through. If in doubt, re-spin for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":171,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"9FFA2EF0A0F011EAB5DEA52FDC0C1129","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"24t7j","text":"Add ≥   to the center of the matrix. Wait for  , and spin for   to elute the DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":62,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"50t05","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"59h1r","text":"","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"6","guid":"9B77FFF092FF11EA91D439D250BBAC0D","id":0,"label":"DNA Elution Buffer","unit":1}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":60,"guid":"AF90F55092FF11EA91D439D250BBAC0D","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"","data":{"centrifuge":"16000","duration":60,"guid":"A454C52292FF11EA95850A58A9FEAC2A","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":34}},"3":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d7oqs","text":"Typical elution volumes are 6–20 μl. Nuclease-free water (pH 7–8.5) can also be used to elute the DNA. Yield may slightly increase if a larger volume of DNA Elution Buffer is used, but the DNA will be less concentrated. For larger size DNA (≥ 10 kb), heating the elution buffer to 50°C prior to use can improve yield.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
